attributes.action: Government to actively promote Commonhold as initially intended.
attributes.background: Commonhold was introduced in the 2002 Commonhold Act and was supposed to alleviate problems associated with leasehold properties. Complete lack of government support means only about 15 commonholds have been registered. Even the relevant minister is from the Justice rather than the Housing Dept
attributes.additional_details: Commonhold successfully exists in many countries of the world. This petition calls on the Government to actively promote Commonhold and ensure that all new properties built which would normally be sold as leasehold are sold as commonhold to take effect by 2020 and to help sort out the problems associated with leasehold tenure. The Commonhold and Leasehold Act was introduced with good intentions but vested interests seem to have been allowed to let it wither before it could do its job.

attributes.action: Record both 'registered keeper' & 'legal owner' on V5C (vehicle 'log book').
attributes.background: In the present system, when you buy a car you can only see the registered keeper's details, so if the car is actually owned by someone else, you could have to return the car to the legal owner.  Also, if a car is given as a gift, say from a parent to a child, the parent can legally take back the car
attributes.additional_details:
My son's car was bought by his dad and gifted to him and registered in my son's name as the 'registered keeper'.  After a 'falling out', the dad re-registered the car in his own name, without my son's permission or signature.  The DVLA told me that, as the dad had paid for the car, he was the 'legal owner'.
If the 'registered keeper' & 'legal owner' were both recorded on the V5C, and both had to sign for a change of keeper/owner, we would all know where we stood & there wouldn't be this problem.

attributes.action: Protect the public sector from future Private Finance Initiatives (PFI)
attributes.background: PFI’s charge on average 15% interest pa for 30 years. We propose that all future public sector infrastructure projects should be paid for through Public Finance Initiative Bonds (PFIB’s) where members of the general public could invest via the post office into PFIB’s in return for a 5% interest p.a.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is currently paying £3,729 every minute to private companies as part of an annual repayment fee for building and operating new hospitals or redeveloping old ones.
PFIBs could replace PFIs and be similar to National savings bonds where the general public deposit money (say a minimum £1,000 for a minimum of 5 years) via the post office into a PFIB this would be used to build future public infrastructure projects. Even allowing for 5% operating costs this would reduce our costs by over 25%

attributes.action: Call a General Election once the new Conservative leader has been selected.
attributes.background: The EU referendum result has left the current government with no backup plan. This petition therefore asks for a General Election to be called so that the parties can set out their positions with regard to EU negotiations. The new government can then go forward with a new mandate and clear plans.
attributes.additional_details: For better or worse, if the UK leaves the EU, we will be entering an unfamiliar economic and diplomatic landscape. A General Election would give the nation an opportunity to debate the implications of the vote and our place in the world. It may not be legally required but, given the vast implications of the referendum result, a General Election is surely a moral and democratic necessity. The future direction of the whole country should not be decided by the members of any single political party.

attributes.action: Set the voting age for referendums to 16
attributes.background:
Referendums cover issues with a long term effect. 

Very often a 16 year old at voting time will be 18 when the decision comes into force
attributes.additional_details:
In Scotland the voting age for many elections is already 16.

It is not logical to deprive these people of the vote for referendums.

A next step should be to make the voting age for referendums 16 throughout the UK

attributes.action: British government should pay costs for 15 year plus ex pats to be EU citizens.
attributes.background: Ex pats that still hold a British passport and have been ex pats for 15 plus years in an EU land and were not allowed to vote in the EU rederendum should have the costs of changing citizenship to that of their current EU home, covered by the British Government.
attributes.additional_details: We had no say in the referendum but we may have to leave our EU homes due to stricter EU rules that may be imposed on British ex pats. This is undemocratic. A compensatory amount of no less than €1500,00 should me made available to any 15 year plus expat who chooses to revoke their British citizenship.  A separate arrangement should also be considered for any British State pension funds that may have accrued.

attributes.action: Put all primary and senior school teachers on the Shortage Occupation List.
attributes.background: The Home Office has enacted a new settlement threshold for Tier 2 skilled workers, which includes teachers. The Home Office Impact Assessment estimates this will result in the forced departure of 36% of migrant primary school teachers and 9% of migrant senior school teachers as their visas expire.
attributes.additional_details:
The Home Office must commission the Migration Advisory Committee to study the teacher recruitment crisis. The HO will need to act on the MAC's recommendation.

Chemistry, physics and maths teachers are already on the SOL but every subject faces staff shortages. Teaching cannot afford to lose essential staff purely because they are underpaid.

42% of migrant nurses would have been forced to leave until nurses were put on the SOL.

Learn more about the impacts of the £35k threshold at stop35k.org

attributes.action: Article 50 to not be invoked until mandated by a special general election
attributes.background: Article 50 can only be invoked after passing through Parliament. This proposal allows the electorate to accept or reject the outcome of 'informal' negotiations with the EU through Parliamentary Democracy. All candidates voting intentions to be shown on the ballot paper - EXIT, REMAIN or UNDECLARED
attributes.additional_details: Following the close referendum result the consequences of the outcome have been more clearly understood by the electorate, deep divisions are evident in many areas. This proposal is designed to rebuild unity by making Parliament only accept the proposed 'informal' negotiated terms if so mandated by the electorate. As the voting intentions of each candidate are shown on the ballot paper, the result will either finally confirm the 'exit' referendum result or supersede it.

attributes.action: In 2018 hold a referendum on whether negotiated EU Exit terms are acceptable.
attributes.background:
Suggested:
The UK will shortly be leaving the European Union; How should the UK continue trading with the EU? 
1. Trade on the terms of the draft Exit treaty  between the UK and EU? 
2. Trade with the EU only on World Trade Organization rules, until a better Trade Agreement with the EU is agreed?
attributes.additional_details:
This new referendum will seek to ensure that the will of the majority that voted to LEAVE is not watered down by weak UK negotiators who, to gain free trade arrangements, might give away the control of free-movement-of-labour that was voted for. 

Or secondly if the EU is dogmatic and unwilling to include UK control of movement-of-labour this vote effectively gives those who voted to REMAIN  a second referendum.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on HS2
attributes.background: The establishment has discovered that its opinion on the future of the EU is not aligned with the majority of the British public.  It is very likely that their view on the need for HS2 is also not aligned with the British Public.  Hold a referendum on HS2 so the public can decide.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a petition about stopping development of necessary infrastructure and destroying communities along the way, but one about the potentially unnecessary expenditure of tens of billions of pounds equivalent to 6 years of savings made by leaving the EU.  Other options have not been considered such as double decker trains.  There are double decker options that can fit under most existing tunnels by using space under the train too.  There is also video conferencing!

attributes.action: Build new coal fired power stations using low carbon emission technology..
attributes.background:
We have learned that Germany will build new coal fired power stations despite urging us to close ours.
By re-opening the UK's coal mines and building new power stations utilising low carbon technology, we can secure our country's energy needs for the forseeable future.

attributes.action: To form a UK sterling trade area
attributes.background:
The formation of a sterling trade area comprising England and Wales, an independent Scotland and a united Ireland has the 
 potential to resolve almost all issues of sovereignty, currency, trade agreements following the Brexit decision

attributes.action: Greater devolution of powers to Greater London - like Scotland, NI and Wales
attributes.background: Considering the size of London's population and the unique challenges it faces, London should have a similar say in these matters, with further powers devolved to the London Assembly and London given more control over its finances to focus on its own priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
Greater London is economically and socially distinct from England. We know this from recent polls and elections.

Areas with smaller populations and economies (London's being larger than many European nations) have gained powers through devolution, e.g. the Northern Ireland Assembly, Scottish Parliament and National Assembly of Wales. They are responsible for areas such as infrastructure, health and education as these countries are best suited to make their own decisions within their borders.

attributes.action: Post-Brexit breakup reunion with Scotland to re-join EU
attributes.background: Should the UK break up after leaveing the EU, following the EU Referendum result, we the undersigned call upon HM Government to consider uniting with an independent Scotland, thus allowing a re-entry into the EU under a Scottish alliance.

attributes.action: EU nationals contributing to UK economy for at least 15 years to get citizenship
attributes.background: Following the referendum EU nationals who have made their lives in the UK,  who contribute to society by working and paying taxes are worried about their future. No one knows what the negotiations will bring. The proposal is for EU nationals in the UK for at least 15 years to gain Citizenship.
attributes.additional_details: Being a contributing factor to the economy of the UK for this average length of time proves dedication to be part of the UK society and culture. EU nationals who have built their lives in the UK, are at risk of facing visa/work restrictions. Citizenship or indefinite right to remain for the contributors.

attributes.action: British People who are EU nationals should allowed to vote for Parl. Elections.
attributes.background: All British People should be given an opportunity to vote and stand for parliamentary Elections, just as 53 Commonwealth citizens and Irish Nationals domicile in the UK can. Should a 2nd EU Referendum be invoked all the 27 EU Citizens domicile in the UK should be allowed to vote like Irish nationals
attributes.additional_details:
The rules for the Irish were framed during the last century.
All EU nationals resident in Great Britain can vote for all other elections in the UK.
These EU nationals resident in the UK were not given a right to vote even though they pay taxes. Some of them for decades.

attributes.action: Cameron should call a state of emergency. The country is divided and in turmoil!
attributes.background: The leave vote was not decisive enough to justify changing all our lives

attributes.action: Set up a unity commission to negotiate the terms of Brexit.
attributes.background: Exceptional circumstances require an exceptional response. HM Government should set aside narrow party politics and set up a commission with the power to negotiate the terms of our exit. This must include representatives of all parties, all regions, all backgrounds, and many interest groups.
attributes.additional_details: The terms of Brexit are too important to leave to the interests of a narrow political group. A commission should be set up with the power to negotiate our exit. This would allow the nation to draw together politicians from all parties who polled more than 5% at the last general election. Members should also be appointed from business, education, unions, the law, charities, public services, security and the economy. The negotiated terms will be legally binding on the government of the day.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords
attributes.background: No-one in the House of Lords is elected. The House of Lords should be abolished, and either replaced with a democratically elected equivalent, or not replaced at all.

attributes.action: Delay the replacement of Trident till after the imminent Scottish referendum
attributes.background: We've all debated the strong moral and ethical case for the replacement of Britain's nuclear 'deterrent' program. However, following the UK's decision to exit the European Union on the June 23rd this year. There is now a stronger economical and political case to be made against its renewal.
attributes.additional_details: Following the UK's exit from the European Union and the massive decline in the value of the £, the cost of replacing Trident is expected to rise significantly from the Department of Defence's previous estimate of around £40 billion to £60-150 billion. Furthermore, Scotland's potential exit from the union means the current base of the nuclear 'deterrent' in Clyde may no longer be tenable. It is not right that we replace our nuclear weapons for status, a serious debate on this issue is required.

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship automatically to foreign parents of British children
attributes.background:
I am Hungarian, business owner, property owner, a UK resident, have 2 British children, born in the UK.
I want the government to give me and other parents a guarantee, that after leaving the EU, I will have the right to remain, with my family by giving citizenship to parents like me, automatically.

attributes.action: New government to reach an agreement on Free trade and Free movement with the EU
attributes.background:
The  EU  has been the UK's largest trade partner for years. It will be
devastating for our economy to not be able to enjoy free trade with
the  EU  as  a  whole, should the UK actually leave the EU in the near
future. Same goes for free movement of UK citizens in Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Now  that  the  UK  has  voted to leave the EU, I believe it is in the
common  interest  of  British people to have a comprehensive agreement with  the  EU  as  a  whole  rather than with each individual  country, agreement  that  would give us free trade and free movement, something we have so much enjoyed whilst being a part of the EU. EU has been our biggest  trade  partner (collectively) and will continue to be such in the future. This should become the #1 priority of the new UK government.

attributes.action: Introduce a direct democracy which gives power back to citizens
attributes.background: Direct democracy allows any citizen to challenge any law approved by the parliament or, at any time, propose a modification of the federal Constitution. Switzerlands direct democracy holds referendums to decide on new and current legislation. Its time to bring democracy back to the UK.

attributes.action: Make  winning majority vote in referendum (such as EU vote) need majority of 10%
attributes.background: Today's EU referendum results show that the country is very much in a 50/50 split with only approximately 4%  difference.  Since referendum are there for major countrywide decisions (rather than a 5 year government) a more decisive majority is needed.

attributes.action: Manchester and London to join Scotland and Stay in the EU
attributes.background:
In the referendum on EU membership Manchester voted to remain by 60.4%. London voted to remain at nearly 80% in some boroughs. Scotland also voted to remain.
As people of these areas we do not wish to leave the EU. 
We wish to join Scotland, declare independence from UK and remain part of the EU.

attributes.action: I would like you to ban birds that are kept in cages.
attributes.background: I would like to ban people from selling and buying birds as pets and keeping them in cages as I think it is very cruel for them to spend their lifetime in a cage and not being able to fly freely like they should do. Birds are born to fly and don't deserve a life like this...

attributes.action: Have a serious debate regarding Capital Punishment for murder
attributes.background: This is not a knee jerk reaction to the appalling events in Birstall yesterday but more a reaction to the ease with taking a life has become acceptable, Capital Punishment would hopefully make some people think twice before ending a person's life.
attributes.additional_details: The progress with DNA testing must make it unlikely any one innocent of a crime would be punished in erroras,  I know happened in the past.

attributes.action: Stop closure of Lincoln Limb Clinic Services
attributes.background: From September 2016, Lincoln Limb Clinic will be closed and all appointments will be at Nottingham City Hospital. Patients are expected to travel up to a 161.4 mile round trip for an appointment. This is WRONG and will cause unnecessary toll on the young and older patients.
attributes.additional_details: This planned action is quoted as 'being in the interest of providing a better service' but in reality, no-one who uses Lincoln Clinic have complained about the service they receive. This is just another money saving measure, removing a service NHS Management know that amputees need, thus forcing us to accept the changes....They have us over a barrel. Please sign this petition and help us to try and keep our service local for the benefit of patients, not the 'bean counters' Thankyou

attributes.action: Make the government increase funds to support youth mental health.
attributes.background:
Due to national bed shortages in mental health units, many young people have been forced to move over 200 miles away from home, leaving loved ones behind.

0.6% of the NHS budget goes into helping young people with mental health, this is not enough.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory that offenders convicted of domestic violence attend a course.
attributes.background:
According to the Office of National Statistics, over 42% of the 
UK population (28% women and 15% men) have experienced some form of domestic abuse in their lives between the age of 16 - 65.
There has been an increase from 1.7 million people in 2012 to 
1.9 million convicted in 2014/2015.
attributes.additional_details: There is  'NO EXCUSE for ABUSE'  in any relationship.  It has become  pressingly urgent to stop the increase of domestic abuse.   We are all entitled to the equal protection of the Law.  The matter should be raised in Parliament (especially taking into consideration the House of Commons  report February 2016) defining the issues.  We want to reduce domestic abuse by 60%, in the next 10 years, by making it compulsory for offenders to attend a mandatory course, "Raising Awareness Workshops" .

attributes.action: Stop the winding down of mobile Blood Donor Units nationally
attributes.background: Which is believed to be policy by end of 2016
attributes.additional_details: Blood is given freely and is a needed resource for our medical services, if this policy goes ahead I am sure that the numbers of donors will reduce dramatically, which could effect many lives

attributes.action: Require the Government to immediately abolish tuition fees.
attributes.background: The current rate of interest charged by the Student Loan Company is currently eight times the current rate of inflation. Quite simply, the status quo will stifle this country's future prosperity by strangling our talent at birth.

attributes.action: Advise China to make "Compassion for China's Animals" a recognised society.
attributes.background: China has no adaquate animal rights laws, the suffering animals endure there is not acceptable. "Compassion for China's Animals" is a group of activists taking positive steps to help dogs and cats caught up in the dog meat trade but they have no legal backing or government help. this should change
attributes.additional_details: "Compassion for China's animals" has successfully intercepted trucks carrying thousands of dogs in hell on earth conditions heading for slaughter and torture in unimaginable ways, however many of these trucks have been allowed to drive away as these wonderful activists have no government support and aren't recognised - they should be, they need to become, the much needed missing link in China's outdated and inadaquate animal rights laws, with powers of there own to monitor, enforce and amend laws

attributes.action: Stop calling the new minimum wage the 'National Living Wage'.
attributes.background: The Living Wage Foundation defines the living wage as £8.25 per hour for the UK as a whole, or £9.40 in London.  While we are glad that the minimum wage has been increased to £7.20, this is not the living wage.  As such, it should be called the Minimum Wage, NOT the 'National Living Wage'.

attributes.action: Ban door-to-door fundraising by large charities (so called 'doorstep chuggers')
attributes.background: This method of fundraising can be intrusive and where high pressure tactics are used by the fundraisers (who may in cases be remunerated based on the level of donation commitments they secure), can potentially put elderly or vulnerable persons in a position where they are taken advantage of.
attributes.additional_details: Our view is that attempts to regulate this form of fundraising activity seem ineffective and as such our petition is for an outright ban to make the position clearer on what is and is not allowed.

attributes.action: Right to choose our own school holidays passed to parents
attributes.background: I would like to see the right to flexible school holidays passed to the parents and not just governed by local councils and schools. The old system is out of date and does not reflect modern living where both parents work.
attributes.additional_details: We as parents should have the choice to take our children out of school for the 20 days holiday that the government says we are entitled to as full time employees in this country. Schools should be open 50 weeks of the year with a only a week at Christmas and Easter as compulsory terms. All other holidays should be chosen by parents with a minimum of 4 weeks to be taken during the year but obviously not during exam times.

attributes.action: Implement larger capacity trains on Cross Country Train Routes
attributes.background:
Since the start of the CrossCountry train franchise in 2007. Train passengers have doubled and are still increasing however the Franchise still run small 4-5 carriage locomotives.  
Contract for CrossCountry trains is reviewed this year so the Government should consider implementing larger trains.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently CrossCountry Trains implement 3 sets of Trains. 
High Speed Trains that consist of 8 Carriages.
Voyageurs and Super Voyageurs 4-5 Carriages.
Turbo Stars Trains 2-3 Carriages. 

Voyageurs operate in the South West , North East, Scotland, South Coast, North West and North East. They are subject to overcrowding on the majority of routes to unsafe levels of passengers having to stand, sit in non-designated seats and scramble over the first available seat. 

This needs to change.

attributes.action: Change the railway lines for a faster train from Weymouth to London
attributes.background: The train takes 3 hours From Weymouth to London (138 miles) and it takes 2 hours 44 minutes from Liverpool to London (222miles).The old Victorian lines are not good enough for a faster train.

attributes.action: Prevent over 65's from being allowed to vote in the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
The older generations are sacrificing the future of the younger population by voting out of the EU due to reminicing on the past.
The final decision has little or no effect on the ageing portion of the population, however it is the young people who will be effected the most as job prospects change.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that it should be the people who the decision effects the most making the choice. Regardless of the outcome, it is the young peoples lives which will change the most. 3 million jobs are directly linked with the EU, with many many more being indirectly linked to EU trade. That makes at least 3 million people who's lives could change depending on the result. Further more, the outcome has no effect on pensions. This means that the household income of the elderly is likely to remain the same whatever the outcome.

attributes.action: Change the tax system so student loan repayments are taken before income tax.
attributes.background: Most students can not use their income tax allowance whilst studying at university and rely on borrowing money from the students loan company to cover living expenses. Therefore, repayments of this student debt should be exempt from income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
These changes would bring the following benefits:

1. Earlier repayment and reduced pressure of student debt
2. A fairer systems for those starting out in life
3. Additional encouragement for further education

attributes.action: Change the title of the Ministry of Defence to the Ministry of Attack
attributes.background: I believe the current title is misleading and the proposed title is much more appropriate given the general nature of it's business.
attributes.additional_details:
The Ministry Of Defence was formally established in 1964, since which time it has overseen 12 military engagements. Out of these 12, UK borders have been threatened on only 2 occasions at most (The Falklands War and The Troubles). On the remaining 10 occasions, the Armed Forces were operating within another nations borders. 

The Oxford dictionary defines 'attack' as: 

(verb)

Take aggressive military action against (a place or enemy forces) with weapons or armed force.

attributes.action: Stop the cuts to the funding of Sharnbrook Upper School Sixth Form
attributes.background: Cuts to Sharnbrook Sixth form are meaning that the school is having to cut around 18 subjects including Spanish, German, a number of arts subjects Electronics, Computing and Geology. We believe that this is fundamentally wrong as it will negatively impact students and thus needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the governments cuts to the schools funding is going to severely impact the education that students can receive at Sharnbrook. They are unfair cuts and make the work being done at the school to help and nurture students to fill their full potentials even more challanging than it already is in this education system that we are part of. 
Therefore we are calling for the cuts to Sharnbrook to be stopped so the school can continue to provide their award winning A-level provisions.

attributes.action: Allow British citizens to offer rooms in their homes to refugees, for free
attributes.background: Many people would willingly give up space in their home for free to a refugee or a refugee family. The British government should start a scheme to encourage people to do this.
attributes.additional_details: There are 20 million refugees in the world, including 5 million from Syria. The plight of "displaced people" is not new. Most prolonged wars cause many people to flee their homes - or from the ruins of their homes. Many live in overcrowded conditions with relatives. Many don't have that option, fleeing across borders to a life of uncertainty, often living in camps or shanty towns. There is a long tradition of citizens giving up space in their homes to house refugees. Publicly encourage this.

attributes.action: An MP cannot invest in or profit from tax avoidance schemes/entities.
attributes.background: David Cameron and most likely others have involvement with entities that exist to avoid contributing to taxation. They either directly benefit from this in avoiding tax for themselves or for others, either way it is a gross abuse of the position of MP to be involved in avoiding taxation.
attributes.additional_details: A law could be created that barred anyone from sitting in the commons and the lords who has had any interest in tax avoidance. If it was found, like in the prime ministers case, that they had done so as an MP (or before) they should be discharged from their position.

attributes.action: Scrap cash benefits and bring in 'Welfare Vouchers' that are monetary value.
attributes.background: Introduce a welfare voucher for individuals, couples and families alike which will replace the benefits that they are on. No one will be out of pocket as they will get exactly the same amount of monetary value, based on their circumstances
attributes.additional_details: The government could work in partnership with all the major retailers like ASDA, Sainsbury’s, Morrison’s, Tesco etc. Supermarkets can claim the money back from their local authority, it will be similar to the healthy start vouchers, but on a bigger scale.  Help stop wasting tax payers money, by people spending our tax money on scratchcards alcohol and cigarettes. Buying stuff they actually need. The welfare voucher will restrict by not being able to buy scratchcards with them and limit how much cigarettes and alcohol they can buy with them as well.

attributes.action: Make Burning The UK Flag a Criminal Offence
attributes.background:
There is a rising problem of protesters in this country thinking that is except able to burn and damage the UK flag in public view. 

This should be made a criminal offence as it can cause great distress and can even motivate people to take violent action against said protesters.
attributes.additional_details:
We should respect OUR flag not burn, rip and trample on it just to make a political point. 

That flag represents us all, as a leading country in this world and as one of the most multi-cultural nations. Whether they like it or not it is the flag of our country and we should not be disrespecting it. 

When they burn and damage that flag they are hurting not only our ancestors but they hurt each and every one of us with every knife that rips it and every flame that licks it.

attributes.action: Stop landlords from discriminating against young people
attributes.background: Landlords legally have the right to disallow young people usually 18-24 from renting their properties. Most use the stereotypical excuse of "they just want to party" or "they wreck the place" I myself have become homeless due to this and discrimination against any characteristic should be banned.

attributes.action: Make the size of motorcyle you are able to get at the age of 19-20 be a 600 cc
attributes.background: it is the threshold of not being too powerful for riders that have been riding for 2 years and allows them to get used to a slightly more powerful bike before they upgrade to an unlimited liscence this will allow bikers to gain vital experience if they feel they are ready to get a larger cc later on
attributes.additional_details:
You are more likly to have a crash on a motorcyle however it should be the riders choice to ride a larger or smaller bike.
This link shows that the rate of deaths caused by motorcycles was falling by 9% in 2012 before the new age restricted Euro laws were applied. And a large number of bike crashes were caused by car drivers not paying attention to them
http://www.motorcyclenews.com/news/2015/march/new-accident-stats-show-large-decrease
These are the most up to date statistics

attributes.action: Bring back the death sentence for proven murder and rape cases
attributes.background: A lot of people are convicted of murder and rape in the UK, and we are suppose to bring justice to those people, but instead they are imprisoned (and usually even get out eventually!) and tax payers and the government pay for their food, drinks, shelter. We shouldn't waste money on keeping them here
attributes.additional_details: The government needs to think how much money they spend on keeping evil monsters alive, the number will be high! The supporters of this petition believe that people who are convicted of rape and murder to be able to receive death sentences from the court. If justice is served, the number of cases of such crimes may even go down. However, of course 100% evidence must be given before handing out such a sentence.

attributes.action: Adjust financial exemption on Fiancé and Spouse visas to include ESA
attributes.background: I am currently in receipt of ESA and I am forbidden to marry my Russian fiancé, or to bring her over if we manage to wed abroad, because I do not meet financial restrictions imposed by the Home Office. My disability truly hinders my ability to meet the demands.
attributes.additional_details:
Fiancé and Spouse visas require the sponsor, the British partner, to either earn 18.6k or have 62.5k in savings of more than six months. If in receipt of a disability allowance the sponsor is exempt from these restrictions, and although ESA is considered a disability allowance, it is not considered so by the Home Office who do not feel it justifies exemption. 

Yet another example of inequalities imposed upon the disabled people of Britain.

https://www.gov.uk/browse/benefits/disability
